page.title: 16The Harbour in St. Andrews
page.content: Most of the boats in the harbour are now private yachts used for pleasure but there are a few crab and lobster boats. The crab and lobster boats are moored in the outer harbour while the private yachts are moored in the inner harbour. The two parts of the harbour are separated by a gate. The Kinness Burn flows into the inner harbour. Once a year the water is allowed to build up behind the gate.When there is enough water behind the gate it is opened and the water pours out into the outer harbour, clearing out all the silt. Every Sunday after University Chapel the students wearing their red gowns walk out to the end of the peir.
